solution_line_template: The first garden has {first_garden_tomatoes} tomato plants because {first_garden_plants} x {first_garden_tomato_fraction} = <<{first_garden_plants}*{first_garden_tomato_fraction}={first_garden_tomatoes}>>{first_garden_tomatoes}

The second garden has {second_garden_tomatoes} tomato plants because {second_garden_plants} x ({second_garden_tomato_fraction}) = <<{second_garden_plants}*({second_garden_tomato_fraction})={second_garden_tomatoes}>>{second_garden_tomatoes}
She has {total_tomatoes} tomato plants in total because {first_garden_tomatoes} + {second_garden_tomatoes} = <<{first_garden_tomatoes}+{second_garden_tomatoes}={total_tomatoes}>>{total_tomatoes}
She has {total_plants} plants in total because {first_garden_plants} + {second_garden_plants} = <<{first_garden_plants}+{second_garden_plants}={total_plants}>>{total_plants}
The proportion of tomato plants is {tomato_proportion} because {total_tomatoes} / {total_plants} = <<{total_tomatoes}/{total_plants}={tomato_proportion}>>{tomato_proportion}
The percentage of tomato plants is {tomato_percentage} because {tomato_proportion} x {percent_factor} = <<{tomato_proportion}*{percent_factor}={tomato_percentage}>>{tomato_percentage}
